p: MIC determination found good anti- E. coli activity with C. zeylanicum (2.52 mg/mL), C. citratus (1.118 mg/mL), L. cubeba (1.106 mg/mL), M. piperita (1.14 mg/mL) and S. aromaticum (1.318 mg/mL) EOs, whereas O. basilicum and P. graveolens resulted effective to E. coli, but with higher MIC values (9.15 mg/mL and 17.8 mg/mL) ( Table 3).
